name: MarkDeck
description: A lightweight, markdown-based presentation tool that runs locally with hot reload, grid view, syntax highlighting, mermaid diagrams, and math equations.
rules: Always use `---` on its own line with blank lines before and after to separate slides
Specify language for code blocks to enable syntax highlighting: ```python not just ```
Use `:::columns` with `|||` separator (exactly 3 pipes) and `:::` to close for two-column layouts
Speaker notes must start with `<!--NOTES:` and end with `-->`
Keep slides concise: 3-5 bullet points per slide maximum
First slide should use `#` heading, all other slides use `##` heading
Use `.venv/bin/markdeck` or activate venv before running commands
Always use `uv` for package management, never pip directly (this is a uv-based venv)
Start server with `markdeck present slides.md --watch` for hot reload during development
For mermaid diagrams, use code blocks with `mermaid` language identifier
Math equations: use $...$ for inline and $$...$$ for display math (KaTeX syntax)
Two-column content is processed before markdown rendering, so mermaid/code work correctly in columns
Grid view: Press 'O' to toggle, useful for navigation in presentations
Keyboard shortcuts: → (next), ← (prev), Home (first), End (last), T (theme), F (fullscreen), ? (help)
